projects.title: Logic Gate
projects.description: A group educational project aimed at teaching users about logic gates and how signals propagate through basic universal gates via wiring. I implemented the node, wire, and gate models and views using QGraphicsView, and developed a gate options menu that allows users to drag and drop gates from one view to another.

projects.title: Get the Joker
projects.description: An original single-player print-and-play game design project that uses a grid and standard playing cards to create a movement system for both the player and in-game opponents.

projects.title: Sprite Editor
projects.description: A group project focused on creating sprites by drawing pixel art on a canvas. I implemented the canvas model and view, frame creation, frame copying and deletion, a timeline for displaying and switching between frames, as well as an eraser tool. I also implemented a bucket fill feature using a DFS algorithm.

projects.title: Simon Game
projects.description: A simple two-color Simon game in which the player must replay sequences that grow longer with each correct attempt. It also features a fun mode where the buttons switch while flashing, requiring the player to pay extra attention.

projects.title: 3D Platformer Level
projects.description: Assets pipline and level design for GAME 3010 using Unreal Engine 5, Maya, ZBrush, Substance 3D Painter.

projects.title: Snake
projects.description: An online multiplayer Snake game developed for CS 3500 using C# and Blazor. We built a real-time client visualization engine that renders game state from JSON and supports 8+ concurrent players. The game also includes a real-time SQL-backed scoreboard that displays live player statistics, updated dynamically using server-sent events.

projects.title: Website Projects
projects.description: Website projects created for CS 1430, focusing on pure front-end development using plain HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap.
